data.title: IS THE NAME VALID ?
data.statement:
In some countries like Madagascar, people's names are all capitalized like <<RAKOTO>> not <<Rakoto>>. 

You are given a list of [[names]] your objective is to check if the name given is valid or not. A [[name]] must also only contain letters otherwise the name is <<invalid>>.

testCases.title: Number of Tests greater than 5
testCases.testIn:
6
RAVALOMANANA
RABEZA
ANDR!ANINA
RAHERINIRINA
RAK0TOARISON
RAMASAMA*
testCases.testOut:
VALID
VALID
INVALID
VALID
INVALID
INVALID

testCases.title: Number of Tests greater than 5
testCases.testIn:
10
rakoto
RASOHERINA
MAHERY
BOT0
RAZANAMAHERY
RANIRIARISOA
RAHERINOTOAVINA
RABEHEVItRA
123456
MAHERIMANAMPISOA
testCases.testOut:
INVALID
VALID
VALID
INVALID
VALID
VALID
VALID
INVALID
INVALID
VALID

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read name:string(500)
write VALID/INVALID
data.inputDescription:
<<line 1 :>> Number [[N]] of all names.  
<<Next [[N]] lines :>> A character string representing a [[name]].
data.outputDescription: <<[[N]] lines :>> {{VALID}} if the name is valid or {{INVALID}} otherwise.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In some countries like Madagascar, people's names are all capitalized like RAKOTO not Rakoto.

You are given a list of names your objective is to check if the name given is valid or not. A name must also only contain letters otherwise the name is invalid.
Input
line 1 : Number N of all names.
Next N lines : A character string representing a name.
Output
N lines : VALID if the name is valid or INVALID otherwise.
Constraints
0<N<=10
Example
Input
1
RAKOTO
Output
VALID
